title: Trackball stopped working
body: This mouse looks cool and worked great...at first. I bought two. About 2 months in with my first, and about 6 months after buying my second, the trackball movement on both started not corresponding to actual page scrolling, which is makes the mouse nearly useless. I would not recommend this brand.

title: Not a braided cord
body: Picture is deceptive

title: Lingevity
body: Didn't last long. Not gamer proof. Buttons stopped working and had to get another one.

title: Perfect for FPS and general computer shenanigans
body: I mean... It's a Razer... Are you surprised about the quality? Top quality mouse for all of your computer and gaming needs!

title: Average mouse.
body: The mouse was good for over 10 days, after that the wheel is very squeaky and loudly at night. I have to return products back to Amazon.

title: Scroll Wheel went out after several months
body: The mouse itself was great. Did what it needed to do. It was a mouse. What else is there to say?Several months in, the scroll wheel went out. It would only scroll up---even on downward scrolling. Now, you would think it wouldn't be an issue, but the wheel ended up being sensitive to the slightest vibration on the mouse, so it would just scroll up in the middle of clicking things.

title: Squeaky scroll wheel right out of the box
body: Ended up buying another brand to replace it. Scroll wheel squeaked so badly, it was unusable in a work setting

title: Very great mouse, especially for the price
body: I just bought it again because I had my last one for about 6 years and it worked perfectly well the whole time. In the last year, the right-click started acting up a bit, but I also mashed the buttons (aggressively) a lot playing Cookie Clicker, so that might be on me.

title: To much money
body: I’m not a gamer but my godson told me to buy this mouse for control.

title: Garbage fire...
body: Had mouse for 3 months scroll wheel no longer functions. This is the second one to have the same problem in the 3 month mark! Take my advice spend a little bit more money and buy a better newer mouse. Hell grab a mouse out of a garbage can plug him into your pc! couldn't be worse! food for thought. . .

title: Scroll wheel is jumpy and breaks after about 1-2 months of use
body: This is my second razer deathadder mouse that has had this problem. The scroll wheel starts out fine but after a month or two it starts becoming inaccurate. The best way to describe this inaccuracy is that it becomes jumpy and when you scroll it is very imprecise.As a device used for gaming it is not very good as you may scroll past the item you meant to select or if you are playing a game where you constantly need to zoom in and out it is bad to have an unreliable scroll wheel. As for general use it is more useable, but not using the scroll wheel makes every website and general workflow a hassle.If you want to take the risk with buying one of these then good luck I am 0 for 2 on these. I will not be purchasing any of these in the future.

title: Scroll Wheel Defective
body: Great, cheap product to get you over a few months. However, the scroll function breaks and jumps when scrolling after only a few months. Taken apart, cleaned, still jumps. My prior device was a more expensive model being around $100 from the same brand, which went defective in a year with the side buttons being defective. Switched from Corsair to this brand hoping they would be at least more reliable, which doesn't seem to hold up after buying two very different models, at different price points, both being defective within a year.

title: scroll wheel issues
body: scroll wheel literally doesn't work, if you are scrolling down it randomly moves back up and if scrolling up it randomly scrolls down. its a absolute deal breaker for me.

title: It's a scroll wheel away from a usable mouse.
body: The scroll wheel intermittently goes the wrong way. It's a comfortable mouse, and the accuracy of movement is fine, but it is absolutely maddening to use.

title: Works great for computer games!
body: my son is very happy with the purchase!

title: Amazing for price.
body: Great mouse overall. Sturdy enough for drops. You can easily select the different DPI settings. It's the essentials version so it doesn't let you chose from the RGB internal lights but allows for other features like breathing and light brightness

title: Comfy mouse, but scroll press is weird
body: I don’t mind this mouse, I had a razor one before and it hasn’t done me wrong. The only complaint I have is that when I use scroll up and down (I use a lot in gaming) it mistakes it as scroll press way too easily, my old mouse wasn’t like that. If I scroll up just a little too much it will activate the scroll press in my games (which is usually ping) and it’s annoying. Other than that the mouse is pretty looking

body: I used to have an old cheap mouse that wasn't bad but wasn't great either, but compared to THIS mouse it was terrible. THIS mouse is incredible, it feels so smooth and high quality. It is a little big and thick compared to what I've seen as the average mouse but still very high quality, I definitely recommend you to try it out

title: Scroll Wheel Broken After a Few Months
body: Overall I loved this mouse. It feels so good ergonomically and the responsiveness is excellent. But I ordered it back in October 2022 (It is now March 2023) and I have to buy a new mouse now because the scroll wheel is going crazy on me. Every time I try to scroll one way it scrolls the other, and then it doesn't and then it does, it confuses me. So in all, great mouse for the time that it lasted which wasn't as long as I would have hoped.

title: Junk
body: I had this mouse for 2 months before it started glitching and the scroll wheel did not work. I don't know why I thought it would be different than any of the other Razor products I've owned. Razor is absolute trash marketed towards the gaming community. They look cool and have edgy names but the quality is just not there. The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. This is something you don't have a choice in since factory settings are intentionally set to unplayable standards.I have had much better success with other brands and even off-brands which cost less, last longer and perform better. Every Razor product I've ever owned hasn't lasted more that a year and has been replaced by something I am using two or more years later.

title: my son is using this to play World of Warcraft. He says it is working great :)
body: We like it! Recommend it to gamers.

title: No Rubber
body: Very lightweight, very plasticky, cheap feeling mouse. I now understand why the price was so low. Would be great for use in a kiosk-like setting. Very accurate point-and-click and will get the job done in day to day operation. No rubber to speak of as described in the product description . Will definitely upgrade.

title: Excellent Entry Level Mouse
body: For the price you can't beat this mouse for daily computer use as well as gaming. It avoids the gimmicky pitfalls of similar mice in this price point and simply delivers on quality. I've bought two for gifts and have only heard high praise for them. For those who want the endgame version I recommend the viper ultimate.

title: new item
body: good brand new not refurbish

title: No changeable dpi
body: It would have been a 5 star but you can’t change the dpi and for games like valorant and csgo it’s hard to play with 6400 dpi other than that it’s a great mouse for the price

title: Es un buen producto pero..
body: Lo compré hace más de uno o dos meses, es muy bueno, tiene un agarre bastante decente y el RGB está bien si quieres algo sencillo, pero hace unos 2 o 3 días se estropeo la rueda, ya no puedo desplazarme de forma cómoda por ninguna interfaz sin que la rueda en vez de bajar suba y viceversa.Ahora siendo la rueda esencial para algunos juegos...

title: Wanted to love it
body: I’ve owned 2 of these. First one lasted a year, second one only lasted 5 months. Right mouse click is not as responsive and often doesn’t work as it should after 5 months of use.. this can be very frustrating when playing FPS games.Love the mouse, just doesn’t have the longevity to hold up to regular gaming.

title: Buen producto
body: Es un mouse muy bonito se pueden configurar diferentes opciones

title: Good starter mouse
body: Easy set up starter mouse. No complaints yet.

title: Great mouse
body: My 14 year old bought it for his game and he loves it

title: Top Tier Budget Mouse
body: Its a great mouse at its price point. It is a bit big and heavier than what I'm used to. It also lights up green. Great mouse if your budgeting

title: Disappointed
body: Don't waste your money on this. 1 year since purchase and my left click + scroll wheel are faulty.

title: Great
body: I love this product so much I am a huge fan of razor and I will still keep buying from Razer. This products overall is a five star really love this item. It is cute and also you can decorate the mouse which is really fine you could just buy a little stickers that you need for the razor customization as your own . Also, it did come with the sticker which I’m really loving and thank you so much.

title: Worth it so far
body: So far I really like the mouse I just got it the day I'm writing this, and ok have no trouble. I went from a 8 dollar mouse to this and it is a really big improvement. I am mostly a gamer so having a gaming mouse helps me get better. Overall I give this. A 4/10 because I have no idea how this is going to work in the future. I recommend and would buy again.

title: This mouse is perfect for your gaming needs!
body: For years I have wanted a mouse with the ergonomic build this one has, when I first started gaming I ordered a cheap mouse from Amazon roughly ~$20 and when I saw this and ordered it I was so upset with myself. This mouse is so easy to use the buttons on the side are perfect for gaming keybinds, the clicking is so smooth and easy, and the DPI is perfect and adjustable! You can set the RGB to different settings such as solid color or breathing and more! I absolutely love this mouse and definitely would recommend it to everyone!

title: Don't buy this jittery mouse.....
body: Mouse wheel jumps up and down as you scroll. I didn't expect this to be a world class mouse, but I did expect it to work a little better than a $3 2 button Inland mouse.Updating drivers, reinstalling drivers, trying different USB ports....nothing worked to fix it.

title: Ergonomic, but bad manufacturing; scroll wheel malfunctions after less than 6 months
body: The mouse is comfortable and fits my hand well. But after less than 6 months, it's already breaking down. The scroll wheel inaccurately tracks my scrolls, jumping back and forth as I try to scroll in either direction (horribly annoying for my work). I wish I could recommend this mouse, but I have to recommend against it because now I see many other critical comments citing the same thing and especially because I bought this to replace a generic, cheap-as-they-come mouse that cost a third of the price but lasted me five times as long without wearing out.

title: great product
body: love this mouse, my go to for years, could be a bit better built and last longer though

title: Really Nice Gaming Mouse
body: I am super happy with this mouse for the price point. I wanted a gaming mouse to use with my laptop but I didn't want to pay a lot of money for it. This one is great. It's comfortable for my hand and it definitely improves my gaming experience.

title: Almost perfect fit
body: I love the way it looks and works. For me, the fit is a little off - If I palm it the way that it's formed, the fit is good but it makes my wrist turn a little too far "flat" to the desk. if it were just "tilted" so my wrist was angled "up" a few degrees it would be great. Also, it is super light. I like that it's not heavy, but I'd like a little more "feel" to it when I go to hold/engage it. This is obviously all personal preference.

title: Scroll wheel is aweful
body: Call me old fashioned, but I prefer a scroll wheel to consistently scroll one direction, not jump all over the place when I'm reading a page. This seems to be a Razer issue of late. I had a Naga that also had a scroll wheel that got jumpy after a few months of use. Prior to this I had a death adder that lasted for years (5 I think) before the right click finally gave out. I have been disappointed that two mice in a row have failed so quickly. I've tried updating drivers, and cleaning the mice internally. I do not recommend this brand anymore and I plan on going with a simple $20 mouse with a scroll wheel that works.

title: Basic mouse
body: The buttons are very loud but it does what it needs to do.

title: Scroll wheel jumps
body: After using it for a week, I noticed the scroll wheel would randomly jump in the opposite direction of scrolling. I returned the mouse and bought a new one to replace it. After one week, same issue as before. And now they won't let return it either - I guess you can only do that once

title: The mouse is great, but the wheel stopped working after just a few months
body: I've used to by Logitech mouses for many years, then their mouses stopped working after a year or so... sometimes it is the wheel sometimes is double clicks, no middle click, etc... I decided to give Razer a chance after many years that I had one (same issue as the logitech), and this time it lasted much less than previous times... it's sad how the mouses are lastingless and less these days...

title: good
body: it’s good, had it for about a year and it’s lasting well.

title: Gross, super misleading. But it works.
body: I bought this item “Used - Like New” because the new one wouldn’t ship for several weeks and I needed it sooner. It was only about $2 cheaper than new.What a lie!Thank god this wasn’t a gift! It came in a crushed, open box. The mouse had like…gamer grease on it? Very clearly VERY used. You can tell by the scuffing on the bottom too. “Like New” is an insane statement. Maybe acceptable, if they’d wiped it down with alcohol like I did.Ugh.

title: Its so small it should be advertised as a "mini-mouse"

title: not too 'busy'
body: I love this mouse! You can set sensitivity and set buttons to do different things. As far as gaming mice go, its pretty basic. That's all I need though.

title: Good stuff
body: Good stuff I guess

title: Scroll wheel stopped working properly after less than a month of use.
body: The scroll wheel randomly jumps up when scrolling down. Seems to be a hardware issue because it's completely clean and brand new. Very disapointed.

title: Good gaming mouse
body: infinitely better than the $20 logitech mouse I bought for gaming and everything else. Would reccomend

title: Scroll wheel stopped working

title: The pulley failed in a few days
body: It feels like it's a big brand and the quality should be ok. I didn't expect the scroll wheel of the mouse to be broken. It has only been used for a few days, and now it can't slide down. disappointment.

title: Good

title: it works!

title: Wheel randomly scrolls in opposite direction

I'm guessing the serial number is old.. Is Amazon distributing outdated mice..?This is the 2nd Deathadder Essential with wheel issues. Will not purchase this again.Disappointed.

title: cat approves
body: i’ve had it for 3 months and i have had any problems, and the led it still as bright! :>

title: Bad scroll wheel
body: all is good, except for the mouse wheel. Scroll gets really jumpy starting 2 months in. It works if you blow some canned duster, and I'm trying to see if contact cleaner can help the situation.

title: My favorite mouse
body: This is my favorite mouse of all time. I have 3 as backups in case Razer every changes it. I have small hands and can't use an MMORPG mouse (big sad) so it's helpful to have the couple extra buttons on the side.

title: Solid for the price
body: I don't use this for gaming, as I'm not a gamer. I only use it for office work. Compared to any other mouse I've tried in the price range, this is by far the best. It's comfortable in the hand, it's light, and moves with ease, and the buttons respond well. Not really much more to ask for in a mouse if it's for office use unless you want to go super high-end4.

title: perfect mouse for gaming
body: i’m so sad that you can’t change the color of the rgb in the mouse! ( i have other razor items ) but it’s fine i made my setup match anyways :)

title: Squeaky Wheel
body: Seems like a good mouse, but the wheel squeaks like nails on a chalkboard, which leaves me with the options of taking it apart and fixing the wheel, shooting WD-40 inside, or returning it, all of which are a pain because I just want a simple mouse that works. Is there QA to make sure the wheels are greased before sending these out?

title: Not sure if defective or just loud
body: Got this to replace a older $12 non name brand mouse had for a couple years that was starting to get old and had several razor mice over the years but honestly wasn't sure what to expect given price point on this one. Overall feel and control of the mouse is fine basically what youd expect for a gaming mouse. The fatal flaw though is the mouse wheel, it squeaks extremely loudly with any movement and its like nails on a caulk board. Seems like proper clearance wasnt given between the wheel and the track it sits in but ive tried to ignore it for almost a week hoping it would break it and wear down or loosen up but sadly it has not and im honestly about to switch back to my old mouse and just order another like it.

title: Better than more $$$ options

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Trackball stopped working
body: This mouse looks cool and worked great...at first. I bought two. About 2 months in with my first, and about 6 months after buying my second, the trackball movement on both started not corresponding to actual page scrolling, which is makes the mouse nearly useless. I would not recommend this brand.

title: Junk
body: I had this mouse for 2 months before it started glitching and the scroll wheel did not work. I don't know why I thought it would be different than any of the other Razor products I've owned. Razor is absolute trash marketed towards the gaming community. They look cool and have edgy names but the quality is just not there. The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. This is something you don't have a choice in since factory settings are intentionally set to unplayable standards.I have had much better success with other brands and even off-brands which cost less, last longer and perform better. Every Razor product I've ever owned hasn't lasted more that a year and has been replaced by something I am using two or more years later.

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Junk
body: I had this mouse for 2 months before it started glitching and the scroll wheel did not work. I don't know why I thought it would be different than any of the other Razor products I've owned. Razor is absolute trash marketed towards the gaming community. They look cool and have edgy names but the quality is just not there. The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. This is something you don't have a choice in since factory settings are intentionally set to unplayable standards.I have had much better success with other brands and even off-brands which cost less, last longer and perform better. Every Razor product I've ever owned hasn't lasted more that a year and has been replaced by something I am using two or more years later.

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

As for general use it is more useable, but not using the scroll wheel makes every website and general workflow a hassle.If you want to take the risk with buying one of these then good luck I am 0 for 2 on these. title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Junk
body: I had this mouse for 2 months before it started glitching and the scroll wheel did not work. I don't know why I thought it would be different than any of the other Razor products I've owned. Razor is absolute trash marketed towards the gaming community. They look cool and have edgy names but the quality is just not there. The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. This is something you don't have a choice in since factory settings are intentionally set to unplayable standards.I have had much better success with other brands and even off-brands which cost less, last longer and perform better. Every Razor product I've ever owned hasn't lasted more that a year and has been replaced by something I am using two or more years later.

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Junk
body: I had this mouse for 2 months before it started glitching and the scroll wheel did not work. I don't know why I thought it would be different than any of the other Razor products I've owned. Razor is absolute trash marketed towards the gaming community. They look cool and have edgy names but the quality is just not there. The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. This is something you don't have a choice in since factory settings are intentionally set to unplayable standards.I have had much better success with other brands and even off-brands which cost less, last longer and perform better. Every Razor product I've ever owned hasn't lasted more that a year and has been replaced by something I am using two or more years later.

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Junk

Razor is absolute trash marketed towards the gaming community. They look cool and have edgy names but the quality is just not there. The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. This is something you don't have a choice in since factory settings are intentionally set to unplayable standards.I have had much better success with other brands and even off-brands which cost less, last longer and perform better. Every Razor product I've ever owned hasn't lasted more that a year and has been replaced by something I am using two or more years later.

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Junk

The only reason Razor products are used by "pro gamers" is because they are gifted to them. Sure they might be good for a tournament but, are probably tossed out afterwards because they are unreliable for long term use and Razor will just provide new peripherals anyway. As long as they are seen using Razor products by the average Joe and e-sports fanboys.Razor products also come with bloatware that may or may not affect the performance of your rig. title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

body: Its a great mouse at its price point. It is a bit big and heavier than what I'm used to. It also lights up green. Great mouse if your budgeting

title: Disappointed
body: Don't waste your money on this. 1 year since purchase and my left click + scroll wheel are faulty.

title: Great
body: I love this product so much I am a huge fan of razor and I will still keep buying from Razer. This products overall is a five star really love this item. It is cute and also you can decorate the mouse which is really fine you could just buy a little stickers that you need for the razor customization as your own . Also, it did come with the sticker which I’m really loving and thank you so much.

title: Worth it so far
body: So far I really like the mouse I just got it the day I'm writing this, and ok have no trouble. I went from a 8 dollar mouse to this and it is a really big improvement. I am mostly a gamer so having a gaming mouse helps me get better. Overall I give this. A 4/10 because I have no idea how this is going to work in the future. I recommend and would buy again.

title: This mouse is perfect for your gaming needs!
body: For years I have wanted a mouse with the ergonomic build this one has, when I first started gaming I ordered a cheap mouse from Amazon roughly ~$20 and when I saw this and ordered it I was so upset with myself. This mouse is so easy to use the buttons on the side are perfect for gaming keybinds, the clicking is so smooth and easy, and the DPI is perfect and adjustable! You can set the RGB to different settings such as solid color or breathing and more! I absolutely love this mouse and definitely would recommend it to everyone!

title: Don't buy this jittery mouse.....
body: Mouse wheel jumps up and down as you scroll. I didn't expect this to be a world class mouse, but I did expect it to work a little better than a $3 2 button Inland mouse.Updating drivers, reinstalling drivers, trying different USB ports....nothing worked to fix it.

title: Ergonomic, but bad manufacturing; scroll wheel malfunctions after less than 6 months
body: The mouse is comfortable and fits my hand well. But after less than 6 months, it's already breaking down. The scroll wheel inaccurately tracks my scrolls, jumping back and forth as I try to scroll in either direction (horribly annoying for my work). I wish I could recommend this mouse, but I have to recommend against it because now I see many other critical comments citing the same thing and especially because I bought this to replace a generic, cheap-as-they-come mouse that cost a third of the price but lasted me five times as long without wearing out.

title: great product
body: love this mouse, my go to for years, could be a bit better built and last longer though

title: Really Nice Gaming Mouse
body: I am super happy with this mouse for the price point. I wanted a gaming mouse to use with my laptop but I didn't want to pay a lot of money for it. This one is great. It's comfortable for my hand and it definitely improves my gaming experience.

title: Almost perfect fit
body: I love the way it looks and works. For me, the fit is a little off - If I palm it the way that it's formed, the fit is good but it makes my wrist turn a little too far "flat" to the desk. if it were just "tilted" so my wrist was angled "up" a few degrees it would be great. Also, it is super light. I like that it's not heavy, but I'd like a little more "feel" to it when I go to hold/engage it. This is obviously all personal preference.

title: Scroll wheel is aweful
body: Call me old fashioned, but I prefer a scroll wheel to consistently scroll one direction, not jump all over the place when I'm reading a page. This seems to be a Razer issue of late. I had a Naga that also had a scroll wheel that got jumpy after a few months of use. Prior to this I had a death adder that lasted for years (5 I think) before the right click finally gave out. I have been disappointed that two mice in a row have failed so quickly. I've tried updating drivers, and cleaning the mice internally. I do not recommend this brand anymore and I plan on going with a simple $20 mouse with a scroll wheel that works.

title: Basic mouse
body: The buttons are very loud but it does what it needs to do.

title: Scroll wheel jumps
body: After using it for a week, I noticed the scroll wheel would randomly jump in the opposite direction of scrolling. I returned the mouse and bought a new one to replace it. After one week, same issue as before. And now they won't let return it either - I guess you can only do that once

title: The mouse is great, but the wheel stopped working after just a few months
body: I've used to by Logitech mouses for many years, then their mouses stopped working after a year or so... sometimes it is the wheel sometimes is double clicks, no middle click, etc... I decided to give Razer a chance after many years that I had one (same issue as the logitech), and this time it lasted much less than previous times... it's sad how the mouses are lastingless and less these days...

title: good
body: it’s good, had it for about a year and it’s lasting well.

title: Gross, super misleading. But it works.
body: I bought this item “Used - Like New” because the new one wouldn’t ship for several weeks and I needed it sooner. It was only about $2 cheaper than new.What a lie!Thank god this wasn’t a gift! It came in a crushed, open box. The mouse had like…gamer grease on it? Very clearly VERY used. You can tell by the scuffing on the bottom too. “Like New” is an insane statement. Maybe acceptable, if they’d wiped it down with alcohol like I did.Ugh.

title: Its so small it should be advertised as a "mini-mouse"
body: Its uncomfortably small.

title: not too 'busy'
body: I love this mouse! You can set sensitivity and set buttons to do different things. As far as gaming mice go, its pretty basic. That's all I need though.

title: Good stuff
body: Good stuff I guess

title: Scroll wheel stopped working properly after less than a month of use.
body: The scroll wheel randomly jumps up when scrolling down. Seems to be a hardware issue because it's completely clean and brand new. Very disapointed.

title: Good gaming mouse
body: infinitely better than the $20 logitech mouse I bought for gaming and everything else. Would reccomend

title: Scroll wheel stopped working
body: I bought two of these and the scroll wheel stopped working on both within about a month or two of use.

title: The pulley failed in a few days
body: It feels like it's a big brand and the quality should be ok. I didn't expect the scroll wheel of the mouse to be broken. It has only been used for a few days, and now it can't slide down. disappointment.

title: Good
body: Excelent

title: Scroll wheel had a stroke after 6 months
body: The scroll wheel literally scrolls whatever directing it wants now. Only purchased this 6 months ago. If you don't use the scroll wheel much it's good but not great other than that...

title: it works!
body: came in perfectly and works well

title: Wheel randomly scrolls in opposite direction
body: I bought this mouse 2 months ago and the wheel is already misbehaving.I attempted to contact Razer support to repair/replace the mouse, but I received an auto response that the product is no longer under Razer limited warranty, and I cannot go beyond this step to speak with a customer service rep. I'm guessing the serial number is old.. Is Amazon distributing outdated mice..?This is the 2nd Deathadder Essential with wheel issues. Will not purchase this again.Disappointed.

title: cat approves
body: i’ve had it for 3 months and i have had any problems, and the led it still as bright! :>

title: Bad scroll wheel
body: all is good, except for the mouse wheel. Scroll gets really jumpy starting 2 months in. It works if you blow some canned duster, and I'm trying to see if contact cleaner can help the situation.

title: My favorite mouse
body: This is my favorite mouse of all time. I have 3 as backups in case Razer every changes it. I have small hands and can't use an MMORPG mouse (big sad) so it's helpful to have the couple extra buttons on the side.

title: Solid for the price
body: I don't use this for gaming, as I'm not a gamer. I only use it for office work. Compared to any other mouse I've tried in the price range, this is by far the best. It's comfortable in the hand, it's light, and moves with ease, and the buttons respond well. Not really much more to ask for in a mouse if it's for office use unless you want to go super high-end4.

title: perfect mouse for gaming
body: i’m so sad that you can’t change the color of the rgb in the mouse! ( i have other razor items ) but it’s fine i made my setup match anyways :)

title: Squeaky Wheel
body: Seems like a good mouse, but the wheel squeaks like nails on a chalkboard, which leaves me with the options of taking it apart and fixing the wheel, shooting WD-40 inside, or returning it, all of which are a pain because I just want a simple mouse that works. Is there QA to make sure the wheels are greased before sending these out?

title: Not sure if defective or just loud
body: Got this to replace a older $12 non name brand mouse had for a couple years that was starting to get old and had several razor mice over the years but honestly wasn't sure what to expect given price point on this one. Overall feel and control of the mouse is fine basically what youd expect for a gaming mouse. The fatal flaw though is the mouse wheel, it squeaks extremely loudly with any movement and its like nails on a caulk board. Seems like proper clearance wasnt given between the wheel and the track it sits in but ive tried to ignore it for almost a week hoping it would break it and wear down or loosen up but sadly it has not and im honestly about to switch back to my old mouse and just order another like it.

title: Great beginners mouse
body: Great beginners mouse for people newer to PC gaming. It’s not too small or too big.

title: Fix your scroll wheels
body: These things last a month before the scroll wheel starts acting out of wack. Scrolling down will sometimes scroll up, about 45% of the time. Gone through 2 already in two months.

title: great budget option
body: good sensor & ergonomics, can drag click, white led, what else can you ask for a 20-30 dollar budget alternative?

title: Better than more $$$ options
body: It's perfect for me. It's a bigger mouse and I love that. I have multiple more expensive Razer gaming mice and prefer this one for prolonged use. Amazing price for what you get. It is only the green illumination, so it's not RGB if that bothers you!

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.
